headline: Chocolate Zucchini Muffins
description: Take one recipe for fabulous, spicy zucchini muffins and add a big scoop of cocoa. Then top the muffins with chocolate chips or streusel and you are in chocolate-zucchini-muffin heaven.
name: Chocolate Zucchini Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease or line two 12 cup muffin tins with paper liners.
In a large bowl beat the eggs. Beat in the sugar and oil. Add the cocoa, vanilla, zucchini and stir well.
Stir in the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and cardamom. Mix until just moist.
Pour batter into prepared muffin tins filling 2/3 of the way full. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from pan and let cool on a wire rack. Store loosely covered.

review.reviewBody: These muffins are amazing! I cut the sugar in half and used olive oil for the vegetable oil. My whole family loves them. Thank you for a perfect recipe.

Good - not too sweet. Made half batch, cut sugar down to a little bit more than 3/4 cup but not full cup, added more cocoa powder by cutting flour amount down and had about 1/4-1/3 cup of the total flour being cocoa, added a few chocolate chips but not many. Perfect amount of chocolate and sweetness. When making 1/4 batch scant 2 T of cocoa and a bit less than 1/2 cup sugar. Super important bake way less than this days - only do about 17-18 mins.
I did absolutely everything wrong (less sugar, more zucchini, apple sauce, chocolate chips, a bit of vinegar) and they still turned out AMAZING.
I made this and added chocolate chips. A little dry but very yummy.
They turned out perfect. They are moist not too sweet & delicious. I added some cacao bits & coconut & my husband loved them. Will make them again.
I loved this recipe, excellent way to use up zucchini. I did not have cardamom, so I doubled the cinnamon as another reviewer did and they turned out delicious!
Easy recipe to make when you have abundant zucchini. Made it with half brown sugar & half applesauce with oil, kids loved them
Easy to make (takes a half hour tops) and delicious! Definitely a make-again for my family. I use these in the morning as a grab-and-go breakfast with a bagel or an apple on my way to school.

These are really good! I've been trying to find a recipe that tastes similar to some chocolate zucchini muffins I ate years ago. These aren't quite the same but they are moist and soft and I really enjoyed them!

Very good. I believe in trying ab original recipe and then review it before making changes! I halved the batter and added about 1/2 cup chocolate chips to one half and left the other plain. Both were good, but I prefer the muffins with the chocolate chips. The original recipe is fine also - muffins are not meant to be very sweet - they are not cupcakes with frosting! I will definitely make them again - lots zucchini at the moment. Missing one? - I had to try one right out of the oven - yum!! I am going to try the savory cheddar ones in a day or two.
Really delicious, I loved the light chocolate flavor with the spices. I used half oil and half applesauce, as other reviewers suggested.
Only change I made was reducing the sugar by 1/2 cup. Turned out great and the kids love them!
It didn't taste like chocolate. The cocoa powder didn't have enough kick to it. It was on the dry side.

A yummy recipe with a chocolate pudding kind of flavour. 

My son has an egg allergy so we made 'flax eggs' and the recipe still worked perfectly. 

For a flax egg just mix ground flax seeds with water and wait 5 or so minutes until it's got some gel-like egg consistency. 

I made them into mini muffins with no liners. Worked great. Baked at 350 for 18 min. I made them and gave my son two. I went in my office to do some work and came back and he had snuck and ate SIX MORE! He said he couldn't resist because they were so good. Needless to say...belly ache :)
My kids loved these. I added about a cup of mini chocolate chips. They were chocolatey and moist. I'm sure I will be making these again.
Good chewy muffin, wish it was more chocolaty....next time add chocolate chips
It came out a little dry but it takes fantastic
Missed the mark for me. Not the intensely moist, chocolate cupcake I was hoping for.
Light, moist, chocolatey

They turn out better than I thought but I think put. frosting on them ,and didn't have any ground cardamom substitute ginger instead sure taste it but flavor great .I don't like putting walnuts in zucchini baking and chocolate is my favorite.yes I would make them again.
these are so good. I have a bunch of zucchini frozen so I can make more!!

These were a big hit at home and work. Will definitely make this again. I did substitute 1/2 cup of applesauce for 1/2 cup of sugar. Also I had no cardamom so i used a dash of coriander. Everyone liked these.

Good base! I made the following changes in my second batch: 
half the sugar (1c)
double the cocoa powder (2/3c)
half the oil (1/2c)
add 1/2c vanilla Greek yogurt
omit vanilla (by mistake but turned out great!). My 2 zucchini was a little bit more than 2 cups but I used it all. Maybe 1/4c extra. 
1 TBS cinnamon and 1/2 TBS pumpkin pie seasoning in lieu of all the other spices.

Turned out PERFECT! Next time I may add dark chocolate chips but no other changes. My 6 kids gobbled them up!

I found these to be very dry, with very little flavour. My kids didn't like them either. I see some people used apple sauce, maybe that would have helped with the dryness. I won't be making these again.

I've been making these for years! My kids and I love them!
I also add a cup of chocolate chips and whatever nuts I have on hand.
Only different thing I did was add chocolate chips on top before baking. Yum!! Thank you for an easy delicious recipe!
this turned out way too dry for my taste. Maybe if the amount of zucchini was doubled, it would help. but I will try a different recipe.

Turned out great! The only changes I made was omitting the spices, increasing the cocoa to 1/2 Cup, and added 1 Cup of chocolate chips. I would not advise reducing the amount of oil as that is a pretty standard amount for this size recipe and would tend to make the muffins a little dry.
These are really moist and tasty I used extra dark Cocoa and chocolate chips
So yummy....loved it. added white chocolate chips and added a bit of cocoa as someone else suggested. They were very moist and delicious.
Made it as mini muffins for toddlers! Great flavour....added shelled hemp seeds and used whole wheat flour!
These muffins are delicious and a welcome change from standard zucchini bread. I left out cardamom because I don't have it and didn't feel it necessary. I've made them twice now.

Used 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown, not as much nutmeg and no cardamom , filled muffin cups and a small loaf. Next time definitely double recipe to make a nice large loaf as well as muffins, and will maybe add mini chocolate chips!
September 5/16 made three dozen today, this time put in a pinch of cardamom and will freeze some and see how they taste after frozen and thawed
Absolutely delicious. Only modification made was half brown sugar and half white sugar. Definitely will be making these again.

I have made this muffin recipe for years. Realized I never gave a review! Fantastic for freezing. I have done it with and without the chocolate. I have added two bananas when I needed to use them. I have doubled the recipe and made 2 dozen regular muffins and 6 jumbos. I have a convection oven now and I cook all 24 muffins together at 350, they usually take 5 mins less. Love this recipe bc you dont have to set out butter to soften and I get rid of at least one zucchini!
I made the recipe making a few subs as a few others suggested, applesauce inso oil, and we used coconut sugar inso white sugar. They were awesome! No one could believe they had zucchini in them!
I made it exactly as the recipe is written. It was very good! Perfectly moist, I would change the amount of spices next time- it needs less nutmeg and cardamom for sure!
I loved it. I have a little one who's an extreme picky eater and he devours these cupcakes. For a more chocolaty flavor I duplicate the chocolate and vanilla measurements.

I'm not sure if you can take my star rating because I altered this recipe quite a bit! First, I adjusted the servings to make 8 servings because I was going to test a few ingredient swaps.
I used 1 egg, 10 pitted dates (in place of sugar), and 1/3 cup apple sauce (in place of oil). I blended those in my Vitamin until fairly smooth. I then added 2/3 cup shredded zucchini, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, and 2 TBSP dark cocoa powder. Mix those up well. 
Then, I added 1/4 cup almond flour and a scant 1/2 cup white flour. I added 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp salt, and kept the rest of the spices the same (all 1/4 tsp each). Instead of adding chocolate chips to the batter, I added 3 TBSP of a chopped Toblerone bar I had laying around. 
I baked as directed in a muffin tin greased with a small amount of coconut oil. 

These were excellent! Not too sweet and they ended up making 9 muffins + 1 small one at 90 calories each! A great treat and one that I feel good about indulging in- thank you for this recipe!

I have made these muffins a bunch of times. This is a recipe that really stands up to people like me who are incapable of making a recipe exactly as is. I NEVER use the amount of sugar called for, nor the amount of oil. I've always used at least 3/4 cup of white sugar, and up to 1/2 cup of agave or honey, and I usually use 1/2 applesauce or pumpkin, and 1/2 oil. I've never had cardamom, but I do add the other spices. These are my favourite muffins to make, and I always get 24 mini muffins and 12 full size muffins. They always rise nicely.
This is really good. I used whole wheat flour and only 1 cup of sugar. I made a double batch and added 1/2 cup chocolate chips to one batch, and 1/2 cup walnut pieces to the other. Great snack.
Our whole family really liked these including the kids. We didn't have the cardamon but everything else. They are especially good as mini muffins, we found.
Perfect texture and taste: not too sweet. Used Dutch-processed cocoa.

I got a great muffin riffing off this recipe. 
I halved the sugar, substituted coconut oil for veg oil, and used 1.5 cups almond floud + 1.5 cups whole wheat flour. Yummy!
Added extra nutmeg and cinnamon for a spicy feel

I decreased the sugar to just over a cup. used applesauce instead of oil. half a cup of cocoa instead of chocolate. I also added a third cup of sour cream because I had some I needed to use. this recipe made 24 muffins and baked for 30 minutes.
OH MY YUMMM!!! This turned out SOOO good! Great recipe for all those zuchinis needing to be used!
These came out very well and is a good use of the zucchini in your garden. I added some chocolate chips and walnuts just as a personal preference.
I cut the sugar in half, used whole wheat flour and substituted some applesauce for oil . Kids loved it
Excellent! These were so chocolatey and moist. Will be making again soon!
Excellent! These were so chocolatey and moist. Will be making again soon!

I didn't know if I'd like the combination of spices but they're delicious. I didn't have any zucchini so I used 1c shredded carrot and 1c shredded coconut. I made them healthier by using some whole wheat flour and applesauce instead of the oil. I made mini muffins and they were ready in only 12 mins. I added some dark chocolate chips on top prior to baking. Wow these turned out uh-mazing! My 3yr old loves them and so does my husband.
These turned out pretty well, nice flavor. I only cooked them for 18 minutes and that was plenty.

I was short on zucchini, so I used a shredded apple, and like many people I cut the oil with 1/2 applesauce and left out the spices (except cinnamon) to appeal to my kids. It worked well! They were very moist an this is the first zucchini bread anything that my kids will eat. The adults liked them too.

Always check the reviews for great advice. I added a mashed banana and only 1/2 the oil to minimize the fat but still keep the moistness; 3/4 c brown & 3/4 c white sugar instead of 2c white sugar only. Omitted the ground clove and added 1/4 c mini chocolate chips and 1/4 c chopped pecans. The almond meal I have, needed to be used so I substituted one cup of the flour with that. Mini muffins were baked for 15 minutes - I made half regular, half mini for variety. The football print muffin liners were so cute that it just kicks it up a notch.
Wonderful blend of flavors. Perfect just the way it is. This recipe is a definite repeat in our kitchen.

Great, versatile recipe. I found the original recipe a little too sweet and oily for my taste, but on second try I discovered you can half the sugar, reduce oil/add zucchini, add chocolate chips, and sub 1 c almond flour for all purpose if you like. The spices are a nice blend -- love the cardamom!
Delicious recipe! My cupcakes didn't rise perfectly, but the taste was great and not too sweet.

This turned out great! Super moist and tasty! I melted Scharffenberger semi-sweet chocolate (4 oz), and subbed 1/8 cup of stevia for sugar, 1 cup applesauce for oil, and about 2.5 cups equal parts white rice flour and spelt flour. I left out the cardamom. I baked it as a loaf for 40 mins instead of muffins. Next time, I will double the grated zucchini. My pickiest eater loved it! Really delicious!
Super yummy. I did a 1/2 cup oil, 1/2 cup banana. I didn't have cardamon so I doubled cinnamon and the added some ginger at the last minute. Really. Good muffins. Thanks!!
This worked great! I added chocolate chips at the end and it definitely takes them up a notch. I also subbed liquid coconut oil since I had it on hand and it worked like a charm.
I would add chocolate chips and walnuts and cut the sugar in half next time. My kids loved it however. Just a little too sweet and not chocolate enough for me. I will try again with these changes.

Wow, I made these and they were just AMAZINGLY good. I made some adjustments - I used whole wheat flour instead and reduced the amount by about 1/4 cup than what the recipe called for. Instead of sugar, I used honey, about 1 3/4 cup. I also lessened the oil by half, which probably made up for the liquid honey that was used instead of sugar. Then, I doubled all the spice amounts and added one more teaspoon of cocoa. I wanted it rich and spicy. So good! Highly recommend.

These are okay. Think I would add chiocolate chip. I did substitute bananas for some of the oil, and used 1 cup whole wheat flour, one cup cake flour and one cup white flour. They are nice an fluffy and moist. Just a bit bland for me.

This recipe was pretty good. But I felt there was something missing. So, after baking my first set of mini muffins I decided to double the cocoa and add half a cup of sour cream. They were much better this way.

Super recipe! I substitute half the sugar with brown sugar, half the flour with whole wheat pastry flour, and add a tsp. each of cinnamon, allspice, cardamom and nutmeg to give it a little zing. VERY flavorful and moist results! This is a most requested recipe in my house and at work.
The spices with the zucchini and chocolate just didn't work well together. Maybe too many contrasting tastes going on? I would leave out the spices if I was to make it again.
Love this recipe....I used 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup of applesauce and added some chocolate chips... perfect!!!

We love these muffins and have shared this recipe with many people! I didn't have cardamon so I added allspice instead and increased the cinnamon to a full teaspoon. I also added one 10-12 oz. bag of vanilla chips and 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips. This recipe makes a big batch and our friends, neighbors and relatives all love it when we make and share. This recipe works equally as well with 2 cups of pumpkin or 2-3 ripe bananas.

This is an amazing recipe. chocolaty and moist.I did tweak it just a bit. For the flour I used 1 cup flax seed meal, and a 1/2c each of almond flour, white flour, wheat flour, and oatmeal. I also used a 1/2 c cocoa based on other reviews and omitted the spices (personal preference). I have a batch in the oven right now that has coconut flakes in it. Can't wait for them to be done! :)

I made these today to help use up some of the zucchini that our neighbors keep gifting us (I love Summer!) I subbed half the oil for applesauce (I might try subbing all of it next time) and allspice for the cloves and cardamom (I didn't have any on hand). It turned out really delicious and my two little boys (4 and 2) are currently being tricked into eating zucchini for breakfast :) I think a little bit of chocolate chips in the mix might make it a little bit sweeter, and I also meant to add some walnuts, but I forgot. I think it would add a nice texture (and some good protein!) to these muffins.
Good! Moist & yummy but a bit heavy on the cloves - my three year old ate them and I'm inclined to give 'em five stars just for that!

A big hit at our pre-school co-op.
Here were my substitutions: 
* For 1 egg, I subbed 1 T chia seeds and 3 T water. (I soaked the chia seeds in the water briefly before adding.) The bread recipe I used yesterday worked w/ 1 egg and 2 "chia eggs;" this probably would too. 
* For the oil, I subbed 1/2 C applesauce (unsweetened) and 1/2 C oil
* I reduced the sugar to about 1 1/4 C. 
* I did not add any of the toppings suggested. 

Bake time was 20 mn for the smaller ones in the metal tin, and 25 for the larger silicone ones.
I forgot to say that I only baked them for 15 min. and they were perfect.

I took the advice of a couple of reviewers, but even tried to make this recipe a little healthier. To that end, I substituted half the oil with applesauce, added two tablespoons of ground flax seed, 3/4 c chopped walnuts, and used white whole wheat flour, and brown sugar. These muffins are still quite moist and delicious, even with these adjustments!

These are quite good and they were moist. Didn't have cardamon, instead I used "all spice". For the next time, I'm going to add a little more of "spices" maybe 1/4 tsp ginger and I'm going to make sure I have the cardamon.

For those missing the chocolate, add about 2 TBSP of cold brewed COFFEE... Enhances chocolate, doesn't taste like coffee, I promise. (if you're not a coffee drinker, keep a can of instant in your freezer for recipes). I used 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice in place of the four spices, but only to save steps. This is a KEEPER recipe, thanks for sharing!!
very good very moist
This recipe is great! Perfect as is and freezes well. I have also made it and baked in a bread pan for about 45 minutes. My kids love it and don't even notice the zucchini.

I thought these were great. I used half whole wheat pastry flour and I used half "pear" sauce (same as applesauce except I made it from pears) and half oil. Next time I will try to use even more of the whole wheat and more of the apple/pear sauce to see if I can't get it healthier. Definately a keeper for me!

Pretty tasty! My two year old ate 3 in one sitting :) Here's the changes I recommend: applesauce instead of oil, molasses instead of sugar, and 1/2 cup flax meal substituted for 1/2 cup flour. I dropped chocolate chips on top and baked around 30 minutes. Yum!

Followed recipe as written except I put chocolate chips in the 2nd batch of 12 muffins. I found all the muffins rather dry with not a lot of flavor. I didn't like adding a whole cup of oil but did it anyway. I thought about not making these again but I think I will try one more time substituting apple sauce for part of the oil and heaping the amounts of the spices to get more flavor. Maybe adding choc. chips again. If after that they aren't good, then I will definitely move on.
Moist. Nice flavor. Will make again.

I added two cups of carrots, subbed the oil out for butter, added slightly less than 2 cups of sugar, and half of the flour is whole wheat. I think I will add 1/2 cup of yogurt next time because maybe the carrots took some moisture out. Oh and I added five dark chocolate chips to each one. My kids love them!

My rating is based on the recipe itself and not with substitutions, which then would give it a 4/5, I think. These were really good after I followed many other reviewers' suggestions. I doubled the spices and cocoa, and doubled the baking powder/soda as well. Even so, the muffins are fairly dense, don't rise much, and the batter really could use a little thinning out. I was tempted to add a little milk, but didn't. Maybe next time. The flavour with the spices doubled is excellent. I might add even another cup of zucchini next time. I also used half white and half brown sugar. And for those that think a cup of oil is a lot, don't forget the recipe is for 24 muffins, and that really is a negligible amount *per muffin.* Because I was nearly out, I used half vegetable oil, and half light olive oil. I am not sure if this mix would differ from one cup of veg, but I found the muffins quite dry even with a cup of oil. As I expected, storing them in an airtight container and letting them mellow together did help moisten them up somewhat. Good base recipe, just needed some tweaking to up the rating. My kids loved them.
My kids could not even tell there was any zucchini in them! Very moist and yummy.
Husband took these to work every day. Priest also loved them

I made a double batch with only 3 cups sugar instead of 4,added chopped walnuts and used whole wheat flour and I also added semisweet and milk chocolate chips to the top before baking. These were awesome, not too sweet, moist and had a wonderful spicey flavor!!! Shared with neighbors and friends, next time I will freeze some :)
My toddler loves them! I used 2/3 whole wheat pastry flour and could have gotten away with all. So good!
These came out dry and to "clove" tasting for us. My kids really liked them though, so that's a plus!

Delicious muffins! I substituted 1/2 oil for applesauce. I put in 1/2 white flour and 1/2 whole wheat flour plus 2Tbsp. Omega Hearts(hulled hemp seeds). I just used cinnamon but put in 1 tsp. also I substituted almond flavoring for vanilla. Be sure and try almond flavoring sometime as it is a lovely combination with chocolate.
These muffins are AMAZING! Thank you so much! I'm making them again today.

This was a very good muffin that I made gluten free. I added 1 1/4 tsp xanthan gum and substituted applesauce for the oil. I also used the sugar/stevia baking blend (1 cup) and added about 1/3 c flaxseed (ground) to make it more nutritious. I baked in silicone muffin cups since these work better for GF flours, and they turned out yummy and beautiful! I gave four stars simply because this recipe can be made a lot healthier with these simple substitutions. Perfect chocolate amount.
Love this recipe!!!

My family loves these! I do 1 of the cups of flour as wheat & the oil is melted coconut oil since we don't use vegetable. So good! 
I bake 1 tray of 12 muffins & freeze the other tray of 12 (unbaked). Whenever we want muffins, we just put them in the oven still frozen- takes about the same amount of time to bake :)
Wow! Amazing! I substituted cinnamon and honey for cloves and cardamam...It was so delicious!

Trying to use up the bounty of zucchini and this one is a winner. I didn't have all the spices, so I increased the cinnamon and added a handful of cherry tomatoes with the eggs and oil and cut out about 1/4 cup of oil...shhhhh, don't tell! Hubby thinks they are super yummy!!!
Great muffins...very moist. I did not add the cloves or cardamom as I did not have any. The only thing I would change next time is to add a bit more cinnamon and nutmeg. Thanks for the recipe!

Since there are only two of us, I cut the recipe in half but pretty much followed it and made zucchini bread instead of muffins so I had to adjust the cooking time. It turned out moist and delicious. The only thing I would change is to add some pecans next time.
